answers.answer: Hi, your symptoms could be due to Peripheral neuropathy which occurs as a result of nerve damage, often causes weakness, numbness and pain, usually in your hands and feet, but it may also occur in other areas also. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. It could also be due to nerve paralysis, like foot drop,. You may need to consult your primary care physician to detect the cause. If needed he may refer you to a neurologist. Regards.

question: My foot is stuck to the floor.My mind can't make it move.  Why?
title: Neurological Disorders
